User-Agent:       Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0b11pre) Gecko/20110127 Firefox/4.0b11pre
Build Identifier: Mozilla/5.0 (Windows NT 6.1; rv:2.0b11pre) Gecko/20110127 Firefox/4.0b11pre

Right now, when one has FF installed and tries to install a newer version, the installer options for the custom actions, like the icons are not remembered. It makes sense to remember those options. If I didn't want to create a desktop icon why would I want to do that now? And if that's the case I can always check that option.

Reproducible: Always

Steps to Reproduce:
1. Run the installer.
2. Choose Custom installation.
Actual Results:  
The custom actions, like the icons are not remembered from the previous installation.

Expected Results:  
The custom actions should be remembered if it's an upgrade.

I consider that as a minor bug not an enhancement but the devs might disagree with that.
